The crawler-beans.cxml is only consulted at crawl 'build' time. After 
that point, the file is not consulted.

So, when wanting to change a running crawl, you have a few options:

� for simple values that are consulted constantly during the crawl, you 
can use the web UI's 'bean browse' function to browse to the relevant 
component, and edit the value. It's best to pause the crawl (though many 
values are safe to edit in a running crawl)). Note that some values may 
only take effect during steps at the beginning of a crawl; in general 
you need to try-and-observe-results or consult the source code. If you 
want to be sure future relaunches reflect the change, change the 
crawler-beans.cxml as well.

� for both simple values and the installation/replacement of more 
complicated components, you can use the 'scripting console' to run short 
bits of Beanshell/Groovy/Javascript (or even JRuby or Jython code if 
you've arranged for that to be available). The same caveats as above 
apply and then some: if you don't understand what you're doing you could 
easily corrupt things.

� Pause, checkpoint, discard the crawl; modify the crawler-beans.cxml; 
then resume-from-checkpoint. You're then certain the resumed crawl's 
configuration is reflected in the crawler-beans.cxml. (At the cost of 
the extra overhead/output-artifacts and slight downtime, you get a 
better audit-trail/reproducibility.)

Hope this helps,

- Gordon
